section_text: On the Mighty Mountain Road Crew, the trucks came in one size: BIG.
That is, until a new snowplow joined the crew.
"You're such a little snowplow," the big trucks said. "Leave the heavy lifting to us." And off they roared.
So all spring, the little snowplow cleared streams while the big trucks bulldozed mudslides.
In the summer, he cleaned up after parades while the big trucks built roads.
In the fall, he pushed leaves into piles while the big trucks mounded mountains of salt and sand.
2.knowledge: pushes and pulls can have different strengths and directions.
2.explanation: pushed means to use your hands or strength to move something away from you.

section_text: As fall turned into winter, the little snowplow began training.
He made the light on top go around and blew his horn: Beep, beep!
He drove forward and back. Then he raised and lowered his plow. Ten times. Fast!
3.knowledge: objects can be seen if light is available to illuminate them or if they give off their own light.
3.explanation: light lets us see things around us, either because it shines on them or because they make their own light.

section_text: Everything was in working order. He could hardly wait for snow.
"Ha!" said the dump truck. "You've never even seen snow!" The little snowplow ignored him. He knew what snow was.
"Why, I remember snow up to the eaves," said a cement mixer.
"Yeah, we had a big, strong snowplow then," the garbage truck said.
"Too bad she retired," the utility truck said. "I heard she moved to a beach in Florida."
"I hope it doesn't snow like that this winter," the dump truck said."It might be too much for a little snowplow.
We'd probably have to help."
The little snowplow turned his bumper on the trucks.
6.knowledge: weather is the combination of sunlight, wind, snow or rain, and temperature in a particular region at a particular time. people measure these conditions to describe and record the weather and to notice patterns over time.
6.explanation: winter is a time of the year when it's very cold, it often snows, and we don't see the sun as much.

section_text: But that night, he raised and lowered his plow ten extra times.
And the next day, he added even more exercises. He pushed loads of gravel. He pulled blocks of concrete. Just in case.
One morning, Will, the road-crew foreman, burst in before dawn. "It's a real blizzard out there!"
The dump truck snorted. "Looks like there's already more than a little snowplow can handle."
9.knowledge: seasonal patterns of sunrise and sunset can be observed, described, and predicted.
9.explanation: dawn is when the sun is just coming up in the morning after it's been dark outside.

section_text: Beep, beep, VROOOM!
The drifts looked soft and fun to the little snowplow.
"Let's go!" Will said. They drove out into the storm.
The little snowplow cleared the streets of Mighty Mountain. But it kept snowing.
So the little snowplow cleared the streets of Mighty Mountain again. It snowed harder, and the wind began to howl.
11.knowledge: wind and water can change the shape of the land.
11.explanation: wind is moving air that can move things around and sometimes even change how the land looks!

section_text: Once more, the little snowplow started to clear the streets.Deep drifts swirled around his treads.
Icy gusts blew against his windshield.
Snow piled up higher than he could raise his plow. He wondered if he should have done more plow lifts.
"This one's too big for anyone to handle on their own," Will said. He called for backup.
"I knew that plow would need help," the dump truck grumbled as he drove out.
The little snowplow wiped his windshield and kept plowing.Silver Fork, Stampede Avenue, Main Street.
That's when he heard a rumbling.He saw the dump truck drive by.Then the little snowplow heard a thundering.
He turned the corner of Main an Ridge...
… just as an avalanche swept down the mountain. WHOOSH!
BEEP, BEEP, BEEEEP! The little snowplow cried.
16.knowledge: sound can make matter vibrate, and vibrating matter can make sound.
16.explanation: beep is the sound that certain things like a car horn or an alarm make. it can cause things around it to vibrate or shake from the noise.

section_text: "He's buried!" Will yelled. "No time to lose! But it will take hours for the big trucks to move that boulder."
The little snowplow drove forward. He backed up. He repositioned. He edged forward and squeezed past the boulder.
"Way to go, half-point," Will said. "The big trucks couldn't have gotton through."
17.knowledge: some events happen very quickly; others occur very slowly, over a time period much longer than one can observe.
17.explanation: time is what we use to know when things happen, like when it's time to eat breakfast or go to bed. some things happen fast, like a blink, and some things are slow, like growing bigger.

section_text: The little snowplow plunged his plow into the avalanche debris. He dug and dug and dug.
His engine shuddered. His exhaust sputtered. The needle on his gas gauge dropped.
18.knowledge: when objects touch or collide, they push on one another and can change motion.
18.explanation: debris is pieces of something that has been broken or destroyed, like when you drop a toy and it breaks into many small pieces.

section_text: Will pointed. "There he is!" The little snowplow dug faster.
Creeeeak! Crack! More snow crashed behind him. "Hurry!" Will said. Shovels of snow flew in all directions.
19.knowledge: a bigger push or pull makes things speed up or slow down more quickly.
19.explanation: faster means something is moving or happening more quickly than before. like when you run faster, you reach your friend quicker!

section_text: Will raced to attach a cable between the trucks.The little snowplow drove forward, tugging.
The dump truck revved his engine.His wheels spun.
20.knowledge: pushing or pulling on an object can change the speed or direction of its motion and can start or stop it.
20.explanation: tugging means to pull on something hard, often causing it to move or come with you.

section_text: The little snowplow braced himself and PULLED.Just as he had practiced.The dump truck's wheels gained traction.
The little snowplow gave a mighty TUG...
and pulled the dump truck free!
"Wooo-hoooo!" Will cheered.
The dump truck shook snow from his truck bed."I didn't know a snowplow so little could be so strong!"he said.Beep, beep!
The little snowplow blew his horn.Together, the two trucks worked to clear the boulder.
When they finally got back to the garage, all the other trucks
24.knowledge: a great variety of objects can be built up from a small set of pieces.
24.explanation: trucks are big vehicles that can carry lots of things, and they're made from lots of different little pieces put together.

section_text: honked and beeped and blinked. "Great job!" they shouted.
The little snowplow's headlights sagged.His plow dragged.His gas tank was nearly empty.
But before turning in for the night.But before turning in for the night, he made the light on top go around.
He blew his horn: Beep…beep.
He drove forward. And back. Then he raised hand lowered his plow. Ten times. Slow.
Everything was in working order. He could hardly wait for sleep.
